abstract: Guyana's multiracial party Alliance for Change has gained traction by giving voice to new generation of Guyanese who say politics have held country back by favoring race over merit, undermining economic progress.
lead_paragraph: A few years ago, a gathering of members of Guyana’s two main ethnic groups — descendants of African slaves and indentured laborers from India — would have been unusual, but a new third party has changed that dynamic.
snippet: A few years ago, a gathering of members of Guyana’s two main ethnic groups — descendants of African slaves and indentured laborers from India — would have been unusual, but a new third party has changed that dynamic.

headline.main: A Multiethnic Movement Emerges in Guyana to Counter Politics-as-Usual
headline.print_headline: A Multiethnic Movement Emerges in Guyana to Counter Politics-as-Usual
